title: Album Page, "Sketches of Architectural Details, Vannes", June 28, 1888
medium: Graphite on thick off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, top right corner: 61; bottom right corner: 54; clockwise from top left: Note - / This is an idea of obtaining a / big shadow by running floor / beams out beyond walls about / 2 ft 6 in and resting roof rafters / on a cross beam which in turn rests on floor beams; gable slate; Dormer; Notes / Vannes / June 28th 1888; an effort to expose a curious corner / water shed.
description: Vertical sheet with five sketches of architectural elements from buildings in Vannes, France.  Clockwise from upper left is the detail of a roof eave showing the practice of extending roof beams far out beyond the wall below and resting the roof rafters on a cross beam that then rests on the floor beams to create a deep shadow.  To the lower right of this is a slate gable with deep overhanging eave and half-timbered decoration below.  At the bottom right corner is a small dormer with a rounded front topped by a ball finial.  To the left of this is the meeting of two corners of a building producing a deep and unusual intersection of the eaves.  Above this is another rendering of this same detail that was sketched below.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Sketches of Architectural Details, Vannes", June 28, 1888.Graphite on thick off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-227.
